title.how: How to understand if the sale is handled by an

paragraph1.title: Check the property listing thoroughly
paragraph1.bullet1: If the listing shows the agency name (e.g. Tecnocasa, Gabetti, Remax, etc.) or contacts with emails like "@realestateagency.it", it's almost certainly through an agency.
paragraph1.bullet2: Often it also says "commission required" or "transaction through agency".

paragraph2.title: Best practice
paragraph2.bullet1: It's always good practice, when contacting the listing advertiser, to explicitly ask if the sale is between "private parties" or "through an agency".
paragraph2.bullet2: Always ask what the agency commission percentage is and verify when payment of this amount is due.

paragraph3.title: Payment of the amount
paragraph3.bullet1: Be careful that some agencies require commission payment during the preliminary sales agreement and not at the time of the deed. Therefore, if the deed does not go through successfully (for example the seller/buyer withdraws from the sale, or the mortgage is not granted) payment to the agency is still due!

paragraph1.title: Requirements for the purchased property
paragraph1.bullet1: Must not belong to luxury cadastral categories: so NO to A1 (luxury homes), A8 (villas), A9 (castles).
paragraph1.bullet2: Must be located in the municipality where you have or will have residency (within 18 months of purchase).
paragraph1.bullet3: If you sell the house purchased with benefits within 5 years, to not lose the benefit you must repurchase another first home within 1 year.

paragraph2.title: Requirements for the buyer
paragraph2.bullet1: Must not be the owner, exclusively or jointly with spouse, of another dwelling in the territory of the municipality where the property is located.
paragraph2.bullet2: Must not own other properties purchased with first home benefits, throughout the national territory, unless they sell them within 12 months of purchasing the new home.

paragraph1.title: Mortgage amount:
paragraph1.bullet1: The total capital requested from the bank.

paragraph2.title: Duration (Years)
paragraph2.bullet1: The time required to repay the requested capital.

paragraph3.title: APR:
paragraph3.bullet1: The annual interest rate applied to the remaining capital to be repaid. APR, unlike the nominal rate, includes all actual costs that are applied, including insurance costs for mandatory fire insurance policies/life insurance policies.

paragraph4.title: To increase the chances of obtaining a mortgage:

bullet1.title: Job stability:
bullet1.content: Permanent employment for at least 6‚Äì12 months. In case of self-employment or VAT number, at least 2 years of activity with stable declared income is required.

bullet2.title: Installment/income ratio:
bullet2.content: The monthly mortgage payment must not exceed 30‚Äì35% of the monthly net family income.

bullet3.title: Aggregate family income:
bullet3.content: If there are multiple mortgage holders, the total income is considered.

subParagraph2.title: Applicant's age
subParagraph2.bullet1: Generally, the mortgage must end before the applicant reaches 75‚Äì80 years of age.

bullet1.title: LTV (Loan-to-Value) ratio:
bullet1.content: The mortgage amount is calculated against the property value. Usually banks finance up to 80% of the appraisal value.

bullet2.title: Land registry and mortgages:
bullet2.content: The property must be properly registered in the land registry, free from previous mortgages and in good condition.

bullet1.title: Credit situation check:
bullet1.content: Banks consult databases to verify if you have other ongoing loans and any payment delays.

bullet2.title: Credit history:
bullet2.content: Having a previous history of regular payments or mortgages/loans completely repaid without issues increases your credibility and reliability in the bank's eyes.

paragraph1.title: Requirements for the purchased property
paragraph1.bullet1: You buy the property from a construction or renovation company within 5 years from the completion of the work (construction or renovation).
paragraph1.bullet2: Even after 5 years, but only if the company chooses to subject the sale to VAT (it's optional, but must be indicated in the deed).
paragraph1.bullet3: The payment of VAT, provided the conditions just mentioned are respected, is still due even when using an intermediary such as a real estate agency.

title.subTitle: Make the right financial decisions for your future, your home and above all, for your wallet.

getPro.freeDesc: Use our essential tools to calculate your home costs. Perfect for knowing what your house really costs and the cost of a mortgage.
getPro.proDesc: Unlock advanced analysis tools for deeper financial decisions. Understand how your wealth would evolve in different scenarios and save thousands of euros on buying your home with the right financial choices for you, getting answers to:

proBenefit.row1: Is it better to get a mortgage or pay cash?
proBenefit.row2: What mortgage duration suits me best?
proBenefit.row3: How much do houses cost in my area?
proBenefit.row4: What are the sales volumes in my area?
proBenefit.row5: What were the prices and sales volumes in the past?
